Market Implied Inflation Signal

Market-implied inflation signal: tracking investor expectations for future inflation.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • Market-Implied Inflation Expectations (1) remain STABLE as of August 31, 2025, with the composite z-score at 0.63, firmly within the defined range. This indicates a period of stable forward inflation expectations.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The composite reflects stable levels for both 5-year (T5YIE at 2.47%) and 10-year (T10YIE at 2.41%) breakeven inflation rates, with their respective z-scores (0.74 and 0.59) supporting the STABLE regime.
  • While 5-year YoY momentum shows some positive inclination (0.88 z-score), this is offset by more neutral 3-month annualised changes, resulting in overall stability.
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse to FALLING if the Market-Implied Inflation Expectations composite z-score consistently drops below -0.5 (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Inflation expectations are most likely to remain STABLE, supported by the current z-score and balanced underlying momentum.
  • Upside secondary: Expectations could transition to RISING if 5-year breakeven momentum significantly accelerates, pushing the composite z-score above 1.0.
  • Downside residual: A notable deceleration in breakeven levels and momentum could trigger a shift to FALLING expectations.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months) due to its focus on 5-year and 10-year forward expectations and their 3-month and year-over-year momentum.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High, as it provides a direct, market-based measure of inflation expectations with high internal coherence.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal primarily informs the Pricing (inflation expectations) dimension, indicating market views on future inflation.
  • A stable regime suggests a mid-cycle phase where inflation expectations are neither accelerating nor decelerating significantly.
  • It complements other inflation signals, like the Fed Inflation Signal (2) and CPI vs PPI Divergence Signal (3), by reflecting market pricing ahead of realised data.

Data & References:

  • FRED T5YIE (5-Year Forward Inflation Expectation Rate), latest 2025-08-31.
  • FRED T10YIE (10-Year Breakeven Inflation Rate), latest 2025-08-31.
  • The T5YIE level z-score (0.740295) and T5YIE YoY z-score (0.880740) were most influential.
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth include the Real Interest Rate Trend Signal (4) for real yield context and the Federal Reserve Tone Decoder (5) for central bank guidance.
